quote.text: Labor's share of GDP declined from 64% in 1974 to 56% in 2024... then dropped to 46%.
quote.detail: The research paints a picture where AI-driven displacement creates interconnected economic crises through job loss, wage compression, and financial system stress. White-collar layoffs increase as AI capabilities improve. The question isn't if — it's when.

threat.threatText: AI capabilities improved, companies needed fewer workers, white collar layoffs increased.
threat.scaleText: McKinsey estimates 30% of work hours could be automated by 2030. That's 12 million occupational transitions in the US alone. The window to prepare is closing.

howItWorks.heading: How it
howItWorks.step1desc: Type your exact role into our search engine covering 997 occupations from the U.S. Department of Labor's O*NET database. We match aliases, variations, and related titles so you always find your position — from 'Software Developer' to 'Bookkeeper' to 'Radiologic Technologist.'
howItWorks.step2desc: Our system cross-references your role against 15,000+ data points from 12 research institutions including the Bureau of Labor Statistics, McKinsey, Goldman Sachs, OECD, IMF, and the World Economic Forum. We score your job across 6 dimensions: task automation potential, cognitive AI exposure, physical requirements, creativity demands, social intelligence, and regulatory barriers.
howItWorks.step3desc: Within minutes, receive a comprehensive career intelligence report tailored to your specific role. Includes your AI risk score, task-by-task automation breakdown with timelines, a career pivot roadmap with adjacent safer roles, a 6-month skills development plan, strategic positioning guidance, and a full industry outlook analysis.
howItWorks.step3detail: Delivered instantly, unique to your role

features.heading: What's in your
features.f1desc: Your proprietary risk score synthesized from task automation potential, AI capability benchmarks, cognitive exposure metrics, and real-time labor market signals. See exactly where your job falls on the AI disruption spectrum — from 'AI-Proof' to 'Critical Risk' — with a clear timeline of when changes will hit.
features.f2desc: Every core task in your role broken down individually. For each task, we show its automation risk level (high/medium/low), estimated timeline until AI can handle it, and a detailed explanation of why it's vulnerable or resilient. Typically 8-12 tasks analyzed per job.
features.f3desc: A personalized action plan including 3-5 immediate steps you can take today, 3-5 adjacent safer roles with transition difficulty ratings, and specific upskilling recommendations ranked by importance. Each adjacent role includes why it's more AI-resistant and what it takes to get there.
features.f4desc: Month-by-month development plan identifying which skills to build and in what order. Covers both technical and soft skills, maps your current strengths that remain valuable, and highlights the highest-leverage skills that protect you from displacement.
features.f5desc: Your report draws on research from O*NET, BLS, McKinsey Global Institute, Goldman Sachs, OpenAI, OECD, IMF, World Economic Forum, Stanford HAI, MIT Work of the Future, Brookings, and Gartner. This is not guesswork — it's institutional-grade analysis made personal.
features.f6desc: A 2-3 paragraph deep analysis of how AI will reshape your specific industry over the next decade. Understand the macro forces at play, which segments will be hit first, and where the growth opportunities will emerge for people who prepare now.
